intro: Dubyaea, commonly known as the desert lily, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asparagaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Dubyaea species are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. They are drought-tolerant and often thrive in rocky or sandy soils. The genus includes several species, such as Dubyaea leucophylla, which is known for its striking white blooms.
